November 17 (Thursday)
08:30 AM

11:45 PM

 Transplant Infectious Disease HALL B

10:00 AM

 Session 1
Chairpersons Faouzi Saliba (University of Paris-Saclay, France)
Lobna Shalaby (National Cancer Institute, Egypt)
Mohammed Omar (Assiut University, Egypt)
Amany Elyamany (Alexandria University, Egypt)
08:30 AM

10:00 AM

 • Prophylaxis and Vaccination
• Respiratory Viruses
• Diarrhea
• CMV
• Donor-Derived Infections
• Fungal InfectionMichael G. Ison (Northwestern University, USA)
10:00 AM

10:15 AM

 Break
10:15 AM

11:45 AM

 Session 2
Chairpersons Michael G. Ison (Northwestern University, USA)
Mohammed Abdelwahab (National Hepatology and Tropical Medicine Research Institute)
Sherine Shawky (Alexandria University, Egypt)
Amani Elkholy (Cairo University, Egypt)
10:15 AM

11:00 AM
  • Hepatitis A, B, C and other hepatrotropic viruses pre/post-transplant.
  • Hepatitis caused by herpes viruses including CMV.

Faouzi Saliba (University of Paris-Saclay, France)
10:35 AM

10:55 AM
  • NTM
  • MRSA
  • VRE
  • MDR Gram negatives
  • Candidemia
  • Abdominal infections following living donor liver transplants.

Mostafa Alfishawy, MD (Misr University for Science and Technology, Egypt)

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row disable_element=”yes”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

X

November 17 (Thursday)
08:30 AM

11:45 PM

 Anesthesia and intensive care Workshop HALL B
Moderators  Ahmed Mukhtar, MD (Cairo university, Egypt)-  Amr Yassin, MD (Mansoura University, Egypt)
Target audience Critical care physicians

Internal medicine

Transfusion medicine

Transplant surgeon

Perfusionist on cardiopulmonary bypass

Anesthesiologists (cardiac, transplant surgeries)
Objectives Obtain an understanding of the latest developments in coagulation and bleeding disorder management.

Learn to identify, diagnose and have knowledge of the latest treatment for patients with risk of thrombosis

Have the opportunity to network with leading experts in the field of thrombosis and hemostasis.

An intense examination and discussions on the subjects of blood coagulation and bleeding disorders, platelets and venous thrombosis.
Additional Instructions Please contact the organizer for registration.
08:30 AM

10:00 AM

 Session 1
08:30 AM

08:50 AM

 Overview of Coagulation

Mohamed El Ayashi (Cairo university, Egypt)
08:50 AM

09:10 AM

 Lab interpretation of coagulopathies

Ahmed Mukhtar (Cairo University, Egypt)
09:10 AM

09:30 AM

 Essentials of Thromboelastographic

Amr Yassen (Mansoura University, Egypt)
09.30 AM

10:00 AM

 Hands on Thromboelastography and discussion

Hands-on
10:00 AM

10:15 AM

 Coffee Break
10:15 AM

11:45 PM

 Session 2
10:15 AM

10:30 AM

 Coagulation management guidelines in trauma

Hadil Magdy (Ainshams University, Egypt)
10:30 AM

10:50 AM

 Coagulation management guidelines in liver surgery and liver transplantation

Khaled Yassen (College of Medicine, King Faisal University, Saudi Arabia)
10:50 AM

11:10 AM

 Anticoagulants

Mostafa Abdel Khalek (Mansoura University, Egypt)
11:10 AM

11:25 AM

 Perioperative anticoagulation

Mai Ahmed (Cairo University, Egypt)
11:25 AM

11:45 AM

 Anticoagulation in high risk groups

Amr Hussien (Cairo University, Egypt)
